meaning: To enter (a name, etc.) in a register, roll or list
example: They were eager to enroll new recruits.

meaning: The act of enrolling or the state of being enrolled.
Possession by a god; divine inspiration or frenzy.
A person filled with or guided by enthusiasm.
With zealous fervor; excited, motivated.
example: an enthusiastic lover of art

meaning: In an enthusiastic manner.
(French Canada) A smaller dish served before the main course of a meal.
A person who organizes and operates a business venture and assumes much of the associated risk.
In a manner affecting the environment.
To supply with something necessary in order to carry out a specific action or task; to provide with (e.g. weapons, provisions, munitions, rigging)
The operation of deleting data.
example: I erased that note because it was wrong.

meaning: Anything that escalates.
example: They agreed to a cost-of-living escalator.

meaning: A group of people or vehicles, generally armed, who go with a person or people of importance to safeguard them on a journey or mission.
example: 2018, TST-00493-18 (Re), Ontario Landlord and Tenant Board (Anna Solomon, member)

meaning: The study of principles relating to right and wrong conduct.
Person living or originating from Europe
To leave or withdraw from; to quit; to retire from
example: The firefighters told us to evacuate the area as the flames approached.

meaning: So as to form a flat surface.
example: Spread the icing evenly over the cake.

meaning: Obviously true by simple observation.
example: It was evident she was angry, after she slammed the door.

meaning: The quality of being excellent; brilliance
An exception, or something having an exceptional value
example: What an exceptional flower!

meaning: Exceeding the usual bounds of something; extravagant; immoderate.
example: Putting a wide vibrato on a single 16th triplet note at 160 beats per minute seems rather excessive.

meaning: Information (or an artefact) that is granted or obtained exclusively.
example: The editor agreed to keep a lid on a potentially disastrous political scoop in exchange for an exclusive of a happier nature.

meaning: (focus) to the exclusion of anything or anyone else; solely or entirely
A brief recreational trip; a journey out of the usual way.
example: While driving home I took an excursion and saw some deer.

meaning: An act of exempting.
An act of going out or going away, or leaving; a departure.
example: He made his exit at the opportune time.

meaning: An organism that is exotic to an environment.
example: Glueballs, theoretical particles composed only of gluons, are exotics.

meaning: To accelerate the progress of.
example: He expedited the search by alphabetizing the papers.

meaning: Great skill or knowledge in a particular field or hobby.
example: The scientist has expertise in the field of nuclear fusion.

meaning: The act of expiring.
example: respiration consists of inspiration and expiration

meaning: To die.
example: The patient expired in hospital.

meaning: Intended to serve as an explanation.
example: Below the diagram is an explanatory text.

meaning: One who explores something
One who, or that which, extinguishes something.
An edifice or building.
example: cloth of a beautiful fabric

meaning: To make easy or easier.
Pertaining to or consisting of objective claims.
The academic staff at schools, colleges, universities or not-for-profit research institutes, as opposed to the students or support staff.
example: She transferred from the Faculty of Science to the Faculty of Medicine.

meaning: The state of being extremely friendly; intimacy.
To make or become familiar with something or someone.
A going; journey; travel; voyage; course; passage.
A wish of happiness or safety at parting, especially a permanent departure
example: a farewell discourse;  the band's farewell tour

meaning: To attach or connect in a secure manner.
example: Can you fasten these boards together with some nails?

meaning: A weariness caused by exertion; exhaustion.
Having or displaying faults; not perfect; not adequate or acceptable.
example: I don't think you can infer that from the premise. It's a faulty argument.

meaning: Pleasing, encouraging or approving.
example: The candidate wearing the business suite made a favourable impression.

meaning: The hair of the head.
